website_summaries.verdict: Largely praised for consistent, high speed and flexibility, although some customers would disagree. A number notice it runs hot.
pros: Easy setup and fast download speeds
Excellent streaming, depending upon your plan
Works best with speeds of 400 Mbps and lower
cons: A few users had problems with the warranty

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with COX
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited to try the new Orbi system with the built-in cable modem. Called Cox to activate my new modem they said the CBK40 is not in their system yet and cannot be activated. A few other issue, the CBK40 is using the old DOCSIS3.0 technology (3.1 is the new standard). Note: the description on Amazon states it works with Cox, plus the packaging even has a Cox logo... Netgear needs to figure this out!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Wow, it really works!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I have spent untold hundreds over the years trying to get WiFi working throughout my older 2 story home replete with walls and rooms; while I certainly didn't relish spending another 400 bucks, desperation kicked in and I figured I would give it a try. With the ORBI system, I am getting a solid 200Mbps throughout every corner of the house, even the downstairs media room that I could never get a reliable signal. Finally I can cut the cord and not suffer through continual buffering errors. Very, very satisfied with this ORBI system.
customer_reviews.author: Ben J Breier

customer_reviews.title: FACT: DOES NOT WORK WITH SPECTRUM!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for spectrum here in New York state. Called them and it was not on the list of compatible modem/router combos. The fact that it says Spectrum on the box as advertised is a LIE. Wasted 179 dollars. I dont feel like shipping this useless item back so the money just burned thanks to the spectrum ad. Way to go sellers. Way to steal money.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Over heats!!!
customer_reviews.text: This router / modem has known overheating problems. It worked well for about a month an a half and then started to crash. I contacted my ISP because I thought the problem was on their end. They traced the problem back to the modem and then let me know it is a know problem with this item. I contacted Amazon to return the item, and they would only refund 70% of the original purchase price because it was already past their 30 day return policy. I do not recommend buying this item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SPECTRUM customers beware
customer_reviews.text: Despite what the reviews say & the product information says, this wifi/modem is NOT compatible with Spectrum's network in the Tampa Florida area. It may have been compatible at one point in time but at the time of my review, Spectrum tech support can not help you make this work on their network
customer_reviews.author: Greg Carlile

customer_reviews.title: How easy the installation is.
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about this purchase and installation (being over 70 years old) as I have little technical knowledge and fewer skills. However, simply following the guidance on the app I was able to install the Orbi and have everything up and running in about 15-20 minutes. The improvement was dramatic with download speeds increasing from about 60 Mbps to 125 Mbps. I could not be happier with the Orbi Whole Home WiFi system.
customer_reviews.author: lga

customer_reviews.title: Dropping internet connection, buffering, not launching Netflix/amazon/hulu, extremely frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to try it out for a couple more days, but so far its so much worse than having the xfinity modem. It constantly buffers my Netflix/amazon/hulu shows and that’s only after spending a ridiculous amount of time trying to get it connected in the first place! I’m very frustrated right now, but my husband is trying to fix it. So in a day or two if it still continues to drop connection all the time, this thing is going back. I’ll write an update.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Connection instructions are useless
customer_reviews.text: #1 - Total nonsense that ALL of Netgear's modems/routers rating are combined. THEY'RE DIFFERENT PRODUCTS. #2 - Followed their instructions perfectly #3 - First thing you do is to get your pc up and running. Done #4 - Next is to authorize it through Comcast. Done #5 - Next is to connect your TVs (in my case Roku boxes). On all 3 TVs I'm asked for my Netgear password. All 3 say that my password is wrong. #6 - Reset the Roku boxes. Same problem. #7 - Reset my password for Netgear. Same problem. #8 - Tried connecting my Kindles (2). Same issue. Doesn't recognize the password. Returning tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Walter E. Obrien

customer_reviews.title: Extortion
customer_reviews.text: after a year and 1 month, the app wouldn’t let me access remotely. The only way to access remotely is via the app. Unfortunately because it happened a month after the 1 year warranty, netgear requires me to spend $140 for tech support to fix it. Sad because it was $400. They also want you to spend money on an annual antivirus program. Extortion!!
customer_reviews.author: Born2bAlive

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Product
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these now and hardly have had any problems with them. One of them was an older model I had for 4 years and the other I've owned three months. The one I had for four years didn't ever drop service until the last year so I decided to buy a newer model since I was moving. The only thing I wasn't thrilled with was that the instructions didn't help me to setup and had to have someone come out to set it up for me.
customer_reviews.author: ACE

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY USED! cox will not help activate and NETGEAR can't track down passwords.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY USED!!! Cox can not or will not help with activating it because it was bought through a third party. They told me to call NETGEAR and told me I'm not the original purchaser and whoever that was changed the password to the device some how. The lady sounded really flimsy over the phone. She wanted a bunch of info from me including name and email then right after asking for that she asked if my name was something else or if I knew them. The person she was asking about I assume is the original owner and said since I'm not him that she couldn't help me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Myers

customer_reviews.title: ALREADY REGISTERED?!
customer_reviews.text: This product, well listed is brand new and paid for as brand new, was eventually found out to be registered to another person several states away. It took a combination of four hours between Xfinity and NetGear to move everything over and work it all out. Seems sneaky, Amazon. First time I’ve ever experienced it and it should definitely be my last. Amazon offered me $3 (INSULTING!) for my "inconvenience".... It took HOURS of time, three technicians and myself to be offered $3..... NOT COOL AMAZON :( Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Jenandako

customer_reviews.title: Overheats and constantly shut down.
customer_reviews.text: I had this installed for 3 whole days and during that time I wasn't able to stay on the internet for more than 30 minutes at a time before it would overheat and shut down. There are no ventilation holes in the top and the modem got super hot to the touch. Needless to say it was returned and I bought a different one that is working very well. Whatever modem/router combo you buy make sure it has vertical ventilation to dissipate the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Sha-Zam

customer_reviews.title: Good modem, bad wifi
customer_reviews.text: Setup is a breeze. Ethernet to my PC worked just fine, though i didn't see any speed increase. Based on reviews I had hoped but I didn't knock any points for that. Worked great. Wifi is horrible. We have a 1,200 sqft apartment. The router is on one end in our living room. Main bedroom is on the opposite end of the apartment. Comcast modem had weak and inconsistent wifi signal. This had absolutely none. We also noticed slower wifi speeds when compared to the comcast modem. Highly rated modem so maybe we just got a lemon. Buy with confidence but be sure to test it immediately for wifi performance before you return your current equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Gets you going in a few minutes!
customer_reviews.text: The setup of the modem itself (NETGEAR C6250) is not complicated. It only took me a few minutes to start it up. Now with the internet provider part, I have Cox as my provider. Like what other reviews have mentioned, I was not able to activate this modem via their website and I had to call their customer service. Then had it registered and it was smooth from there. However, to save yourself some headaches, regardless of the service provider and before you purchase a modem replacement, you should do your homework and check first with your provider if the modem you're planning to get is supported with your subscription speed.
customer_reviews.author: Nikko Mina

customer_reviews.title: I paid for a new Router and got a used one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a NEW item. It showed up, was in sealed packaging, but this Router had already been setup and had already been used on the cable provider I'm using it for. I had to hard reset it to get the router back to it's defaults and my ISP had to remove it from another account as they detected that its MAC had already been registered to another account & location. What the crap Amazon?
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C Johnson

customer_reviews.title: it works beautifully and was pretty easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for almost a week now, and it has been working very well for me. My plan with xFinity calls for 55 mbps speeds and I actually got more than that with this router when I tested it. For my one bedroom apartment, it works beautifully and was pretty easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: S Mar

customer_reviews.title: Drops wifi signal
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited to have my own router. Had minor issues setting it up with xfnity, but once it was set up the wifi would literally drop almost every hour, and working through a Remote Desktop that I have to log into, this was such a hassle, especially after paying a pretty penny. I read reviews on the netgear community and this seems to be a common problem for this particular model C7000,andV2. I bit the bullet and bought a different branded router and surprise - no wifi drops. Not sure what the issue is with this model but something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Aimmee Chin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router as a replacement to Xfinity's leased router and as soon as I did my internet speed dropped dramatically. With the Xfinity router it was testing at 150- 170 Mbps and after I installed this router it dropped to 15-30 Mbps. I only have 4 devices on this router and roughly 9 months later it is testing at 5-10 Mbps. Also the technical support expires after 3 months and then you have to pay like $100 if you want to have it. This product was a total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Barry Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Very unsteady unit
customer_reviews.text: For the first month after delivery and installation on a Charter/Spectrum cable service it ran at 185+mbps download speed then it started going offline and slowing down significantly. Called Netgear who claimed that Charter/Spectrum was slowing down the signal to under 100Mbps. Netgear support has been very unhelpful and even thogh the issue was brought to them within 30 days they put us off until the issues became untenable. They offered very little in the way of resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Less than Xfinity lease
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to switch to a cable based router/modem from our phone company. Installer from Xfinity liked it, knew all the standard passwords. Parental control allows you to select which device connecting gets what settings. Very handy for tweens and teens in the house but mom and dad still want to watch netflix. Great unit so far, plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great modem!!
customer_reviews.text: Had the regular modem from spectrum. WiFi signal pretty much covered our living room. Bought the Netgear, was super easy to hook up, literally I unhooked all the stuff from the old modem and connected it back up to the new one. Called spectrum to activate the new modem on my account, all they needed was the MAC address for it which is on the back of the router. And then everything was up and running. Now I get full bars all throughout my house. Very happy with my purchase so far ( it only came today 4/30 )
customer_reviews.author: Sour

customer_reviews.title: Great product but I goofed.
customer_reviews.text: Preforms as advertised. I have nothing bad to say about it but I shouldn't have ordered it. If I hadn't discarded the original packaging and used it for a couple weeks I'd return it. Before you order this be sure you understand the implications of DOCSIS 3.0 vs 3.1 with your ISP. I didn't and I purchased the wrong product. That costs me more than half my available bandwidth. If DOCSIS 3.0 will fully utilize your connection this product is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Good range, works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: We needed this for coverage all over our house, into the yard, and into a casita across a courtyard. It does that with a strong signal. It extends to a smart swimming pool control panel by going through 5 walls, a set of wall cabinets, a metal mesh fence, a 2 car garage, and beyond that about 15 feet through the yard into the control panel. I thought I was going to have to get a range extender but it isn't needed. I estimate excellent range of about 75 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline B.

customer_reviews.title: Lost faith in routers, until this one...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Arris SBG7400 with this router. The old one constantly needed to be reset to work. I even put a timer on it so that it would reset itself at 4:00 am every day. It still needed a reset most days, sometimes twice. The previous Arris/Motorola router did basically the same thing. Decided to try another brand. Let me just say, I'm glad I did. This Netgear Nighthawk has been in use for close to 2 months, with zero drop outs. Very happy to finally be free of the reset game, and internet speeds are always fast. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish - avoid it!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the setup procedure exactly, but the only light which came on and stayed on was the downstream LED. It refused to connect to the internet, and whatever I did (wirelessly, wired) nothing would induce it to do anything, so I had no alternative but to return it. What a disappointment, as I have had Netgear routers before and they have performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. David

customer_reviews.title: Wifi was way to slow
customer_reviews.text: After this was up and running my wifi signal was not even close to what I got from my rented Comcast router modem.before I changed it i ran a speed test and ny phone got 236 down load speed. I pay for 200 speed. After I swapped to this product I got 35 download speed. Netgear blamed Comcast Comcast told me to return it which is what I did. Maybe I had a bad unit. I have not tried to buy another modem router since
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worse one yet..
customer_reviews.text: This was the 3rd modem/wifi unit that I have tried. Thought it would work due to the price, speed, and number of reviews. It was the worst yet. Constant buffering, and dropped connection. Disney Plus and Netflix will hardly play a movie. I had to call cox to connect this one since it will not do it automatically online through the install process. Doesn't recognize it. So that was a pain since wait times are long. Really a pain too since we could not watch movies and kids can not say connected to their online classes. Returning. And I believe we will need to go back to the rented cox unit, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen M.

customer_reviews.title: Gets EXTREMELY HOT at first
customer_reviews.text: Update: it's been almost a month now and it's sitting by a window. Since the first week, it has not gotten super hot. We feel safe to keep it. Original review: We're watching this, it's only had a week of use so far, but it may need to go back. It gets VERY HOT!! It is running both a 2G and a 5G line. Maybe that's why? We haven't had issues with speed, but we've set it near a window and away from paper because it just gets so so so hot.
customer_reviews.author: jmw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, EXCEPT... (Apple users)
customer_reviews.text: Really excellent cable modem and router combination. I bought this to ditch the monthly rental fees. This device has very limited compatibility with peripheral USB storage devices as it strongly favors a more Windows-oriented file system format. It makes far more sense for Netgear to expand file format compatibility than to expect its thousands of users to have to unload, reformat, and then reload their storage devices just so that it can be compatibility with their devices. Highly recommended device except for Apple users seeking to connect wirelessly to storage devices.
customer_reviews.author: Otter Opinion™

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating device/company
customer_reviews.text: This device worked great for the first 6 months, but now it has problems. It disconnects from Comcast for a couple minutes each day (at least once day, sometimes 2 or 3 times). The bigger issue is that has reset itself to factory defaults 3 times in the past 2 months. The device supposedly has a 1-year warranty, but to get to a support person after the first 3 months, you have pay for a support contract. Why offer a 1-year warranty if there's really no way to get it replaced after the first 3 months?
customer_reviews.author: S. Shipe

customer_reviews.title: Works for cloud data backup, certified at highest compatibility level by Spectrum/TWC
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an earlier Netgear wifi router cable modem that is no longer certified at the highest level of compatibility by Spectrum/TWC. The C7000 DOES have the highest compatibility rating currently, and it proved that to me by making possible the use of Acronis 2020 for automated daily backup of my laptop data to cloud storage. Backup would not complete successfully using the obsolete router. Video streaming is much better with the new router is well. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: etymologik

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this purchase. Definitely worth every penny! The way I see it is if you rent the xfinity modem in a year you pay around 14$ a month and in 12 months you have already paid 168$ to rent some equipment. Anyways I would recommend the Netgear Nighthawk modem I got the one without voice as I only have internet service through Xfinity and let me tell you setting up was quick and easy and also my connection at home has been great not once since I have purchased have I had any issues. My husband is a gamer and I love watching YouTube or Netflix at the same time and never have had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coming from an Apple Network, I’m Happy
customer_reviews.text: Coming from an Apple Time Capsule and 2x Airport Expresses, I’m thoroughly pleased with this product. I enjoyed the ease of using those devices, but it was time for an upgrade. If you’re familiar with the Airport Utility iOS app, you’ll enjoy this interface and setup fairly well. The connection speeds are great and they make it fairly easy to install. We have 150mb service through Xfinity and have roughly 35+ devices on our network between computers, Apple TVs, smart devices, and we get consistently 175+mb speeds throughout our 3,000sqft 2 level house.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Louthan

customer_reviews.title: Better than Motorola
customer_reviews.text: Better than Motorola. Unfortunately I had to buy mine at Best Buy because Amazon dropped the ball with my delivery. I originally bought the Motorola 7550 modem router first one came in dead second replacement never worked correctly. So I ordered the Netgear modem router but Amazon delayed my delivery after four days I had to go to Best Buy to buy it and I am very very pleased with it. Would recommend definitely over Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: It works and is saving us $11 in rental fees from the cable company. Who wouldn’t replace the rental box. WiFi could be better the ethernet ports won’t work with any cat5 or cat6 we had to buy all new ethernet for outed wired devices. Our security camera that are wired are very slow. Tec support sucks. I figured out the issues with the box by a youtube video needed to change a setting tec support just told me to rest the box and start over. It didn’t fix it. They really need better tec support for the company. Tec support sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Prefect for Optimum customers
customer_reviews.text: I bought several other modems and none worked as well as this one. I have Optimum and wanted to save the extra $10 on a modem monthly fee. This one works much better than the equipment I was renting, plus it it two in one. Modem and WiFi. My connection doesn't drop and the speeds are high. The setup was easy enough and their admin panel is very easy to use. I am so glad to have found this. If you have Optimum this is the one to get. Stop paying them for equipment that isn't very reliable and start saving. Use the extra $1,200 yearly to treat yourself instead ;)
customer_reviews.author: John Carrey

customer_reviews.title: The product works as advertised but the install for COX cable is not straightforward
customer_reviews.text: The install directions delivered with the product are for a comcast installation. When I initiated a COX cable installation there was no help on the cox web site for third party modems. The "help desk" went thru the motions but when I refused to buy the "advanced cox help" the result was turning off the cox modem and not turning on the netgear modem. I gave in and paid the $30 for the advanced help and all the advanced help did as far as I could tell was "release" the captive netgear modem so that I could log into the routerlogin.net and complete the installation. So beware cox if you buy this modem.
customer_reviews.author: dalemu

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Comcast!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent wireless router handling cellphones, iPads, computers, Xbox, printer, echo dots and more. Oh, and streaming! Dumped cable and cut cord. Researched for quality wireless router that was not a bank buster yet compatible with xfinity. Heck, router purchase alone woulda paid for itself over renting from Comcast their router, tax and fees etc. But cut cord completely but still with Comcast for internet access. Had to call them and register the router and it has worked perfectly ever since...and not paying those thieves for cable or rental equipment! Using fire cube with Hulu and it is all flawless and a lot cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: MoJO

customer_reviews.title: Works great now, after 1 day of problems, (Disable Port Scan and DoS Protection)
customer_reviews.text: The first day, this thing was dropping LAN and WIFI connections for 30-90s every 20 minutes. I was ready to return it. After doing a factory reset and changing the config, it became very fast and reliable. When it was unreliable, it had the following settings: Router IP: 192.168.1.1, Port Scan and DoS Protection was enabled, Guest WIFI enabled, using the 2GHz WIFI After the factory reset, I used these settings and it is flawless: Router IP: 192.168.0.1, Port Scan and DoS Protection is disabled, Guest WIFI enabled, using mostly the 5GHz WIFI. I think the Port Scan and DoS Protection is what was causing my router to freeze up and drop connections.
customer_reviews.author: Trogdor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Intall
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Comcast(Xfinity) modem/router. This product was very easy to install and only took 2 minutes, just screw in the cable on the back and plug in power. Wait ten minutes for the modem to load and try and go on a website. It directs you to Netgears web to make your account. Put in the serial number on the new modem and create a password. Next I called Comcast to have them "hit" the modem and then it was up and running. The longest part was calling Comcast, took about 10 minutes. It has been 3 days and havent had a problem streaming yet. Just dropped off the rental modem back at Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Sean, MI

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly good performance &  great solution to all WiFi problems
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly good package in every respect. It is particularly indicated when someone like myself would constantly incur annoying drops of signal without figuring out whether it was a problem with their modem, their internet company signal, or their router - or incur poor performance Or weakening of WiFi at far points of the living quarters . Over the years, I have been confronted with this dilemma time and time again.I could not be happier with this solution.The combination modem/router is of surprising quality & instantly & once-in-for-all provides excellent WiFi without any drops longterm. The extender unit is just as good with extension of WiFi for hundreds of feet beyond my house.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tep

customer_reviews.title: Get another brand
customer_reviews.text: After seeing the high rating and good review, I decided to get this modem/wifi combo. I installed June 9, and the wifi started dropping intermittently towards end of July. Rebooting the router does not help. I noticed that the consistent good reviews were 2017. More recent reviews, are hit and miss. Maybe I got a lemon? Nonetheless, I'm not going to get another Netgear product, for a while, even if the price is reasonable. I just installed Motorola MG7700. Expensive, but it is much faster than this Netgear when it was working fine. I'm not endorsing MG7700 yet, it is too early to tell.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L

customer_reviews.title: False claim! Not work with comcast xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt work with xfinity as claimed. Bought 2 different units (c7000v2), first one was an open box from amazon, didnt work, call in for replacement, they denied and refused. No problem, item was returned to seller. Then i purchased a new one from best buy, still no connection. My xfinity rental modem has been working fine so its not the outlet or service, its the netgear modem itself that doesnt support..
customer_reviews.author: Azuka

customer_reviews.title: Awful Wifi - Good ethernet
customer_reviews.text: Ever since we bought this product, the WiFi is spotty and goes in and out. We've contacted XFINITY multiple times, thinking it was them. They finally told us to check with Netgear and it was outside of the "complimentary" 90-day support. So, we ended up having to pay for support and didn't get any help outside of what we could google and do ourselves, and have done before. This WiFi is pretty bad, but if you can hardwire, it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great, but one major flaw.
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, this router has been great. However, in the middle of the night, it reset itself to factory defaults. I've never had a router do this before. A quick Google search shows that this is a pretty common problem with these routers. Nobody touched it. It just reset to factory defaults and all of my devices lost their wifi signal. Unfortunately it's past the return Window. I'm going to get something else because apparently once this occurs, it *will* happen again according to the Google.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Adler

customer_reviews.title: No QoS and site filtering does not work
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was useless for me because the two things that I changed my previous router (apple extreme) was to get some parental controls like site filtering but it does not work. For general parental controls it forces you to use OpenDNS which I am not comfortable doing for security and privacy reasons. Also there are no manual settings for QoS. So not even sure if QoS exists on this router or not. I didnt want to go through the hassle of buying another modem and router so just stuck with this white elephant now :(
customer_reviews.author: BigShoppingRiverCruiser

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, solid cable modem-wifi unit
customer_reviews.text: Set up is pretty easy. Using their app, I was able to do the base setup easily. The WiFi range is not quite as good as I would like. (There's a corner of the house where the signal is weak), but otherwise it's sufficient. I've used several NetGear units over twenty years and I found them to be pretty solid overall. I think because of the app, this was the easiest to set up despite it potentially being the most complicated. No complaints about the Internet speed. It's exactly in line with what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nishimura

customer_reviews.title: worked for xfinity-got rid of the rented one
customer_reviews.text: but there is not a phone jack on this one, so if you have the triple play and still need a phone jack, you will have to buy a different one
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and affordable, my modem issues are gone!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best modem I ever owned. I needed a modem that would offer high speed and would let me connect remote to my work files. the previous modem rented through my internet provided, even after enabling my laptop still blocked it from remote access. this modem was so easy to install and control through the Nighthawk app! in addition my remote access issues went away. I previously owed Netgear WIFI extenders that I was able to set up through the app as well and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: 4A

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a couple months ago due to the need of a router and modem. After using it I would definitely recommend to another person and for the price it is well worth it compared to purchasing them separately.Also takes up less space and less wires to hire compared to having them separate I use this for playing PS4, multiple phones and laptops with no issues at all of being able to keep up with he demand.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Z

customer_reviews.title: DELIVERS THE SPEED I WANTED. EASY TO INSTALL.
customer_reviews.text: I PAY MY PROVIDER FOR 200 MBPS. THE PREVIOUS MODEM (ARRIS SB 640) DELIVERED ONLY 116 MBPS EVEN THOUGH THE COMPANY RATED IT AT 300 MBPS. SPECTRUM HAS THEIR OWN LIST AND WHAT SPEEDS MODEMS DELIVER WITH THEIR SYSTEM. THIS NG C7000 IS RATED UP TO 400 MBPS IF YOU USE SPECTRUM. NOTE OF INTEREST, WHEN I INITIALLY HOOKED UP THE MODEM AND HAD SPECTRUM ACTIVATE THE NEW MODEM, I INITIALLY ONLY RECEIVED 116 MBPS. I CALLED THE SPECTRUM TECH AND HE FLIPPED A SWITCH AND I THEN RECEIVED 220 MBPS. I WON'T PAY FOR THE HIGHER SPEEDS JUST YET, BUT I AM GETTING WHAT I PAY FOR.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny in Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: No access to support besides a community site which might be great if its information is correct. Unfortunately, it isn’t correct. Router page doesn’t contain menu options that the documentation claims are there (including the option to update the router). Should never have replaced previous Motorola router. Strongly do not recommend. ** IMPORTANT ** Consumer Reports has issued vulnerability issues with hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: This modem is garbage. I've spent the last week dealing with connection drops every 15 minutes while streaming TV. I gave it the benefit of the doubt thought maybe there could be an issue on Comcast's end. But as soon as I plugged in the rented modem (hadn't returned it yet), no drops at all. I was really looking forward to not having to rent a modem from Comcast anymore, but this turd isn't it. Returning this thing tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Perfect Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Netgear provides fast efficient customer service 24/7.
customer_reviews.text: Great Customer Service, superb WiFi delivery, affordable pricing By Crispy Patas 12345 Big surprise at Staples when I took the cable modem box to the cashier. There was a cinder block in the box. The store is plagued with merchandise shrinkage (shoplifting). The manage went to the storage area to get a sealed Netgear Cable Modem for me. I am free of my SuddenLink shackles. Two whole years of spotty WiFi cost hours on the phone waiting on hold. Frustration drove me search for a solution. I decided to invest in a Netgear Cable Modem that mows delivers a strong WIFi signal and incredible streaming of New flux, Amazon Prime Videos, and Disney Hulu ESPN content.
customer_reviews.author: Lunacascabelera

customer_reviews.title: Customer support worse than zero
customer_reviews.text: Called today, selected Tech Support from Netgear's menu options, waited 18 minutes, phone answered by a barely-understandable person, who then informed me that I had a technical question and she was going to transfer me to Tech Support. When I protested that I had selected Tech Support from their menu options and didn't want to be transferred, she hung up. Of course, if we had known about Netgear's less-than-zero customer support, we would not have purchased their product.
customer_reviews.author: visualgirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy Instalation, works well
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to buy a router modem for my Comcast system, not knowing what difficulties I would encounter. Basically, I opened the box, unplugged my old router/modem (that I was renting from Comcast), and started it up. The instructions tell you that you may need to call the cable company, which I did as the cable channels did not appear. Comcast simply rebooted the system from their end and five minutes later, everything worked well. No more rental charges from Comcast. The WiFi works great. I definitely recommend this item. BTW, I rated "Tech Support" as a five for Comcast, not Netgear, as I did not need to call Netgear tech support.
customer_reviews.author: DC TC

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a great modem. Just buy and thank me later
customer_reviews.text: Are people really still paying to rent a modem at 10$ a month. What a scam. Smarten up people this is a good investment. I brought this two years ago it’s still a beast with lightning speeds. The guest network is a good feature. After all these years I still have no clue how wifi is even possible one thing I do know is I pay for 150mbps this modem gives me over 200mbps no matter what time of day. It’s a good buy a good modem that’s and reliable stylish. Just hit the buy button
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: Great so far.
customer_reviews.text: We have had Netgear stuff for years. Never had any issues until recently, our 6-year-old modem/router started acting crazy and with my school at home, I can't take the risk of test day and no internet. So we bought a "bigger" modem/router combo. So far, it has been great, no in/out service. We still use the extender for the deck and TV outside.
customer_reviews.author: Gina M. Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t do the job.....
customer_reviews.text: Although this was super easy to install, I personally didn’t like it because net-gear kept blocking all of my devices out of my own internet. Funny thing is I didn’t even set up device control. There was no other unknown devices connected to it so I really think it’s a netgear thing. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: get rid of your Xfinity box ASAP
customer_reviews.text: After poor signal (despite being on a fast data plan), I finally stopped listening to Xfinity support, and simply got a new modem/router. And now my speed is actually the speed I pay for. CONSISTENTLY. This was pretty simple to install (I'm not the most technologically inclined person).
customer_reviews.author: LKSFO

customer_reviews.title: A Best Choice Router to Consider!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 3-level, 2200 Sq ft home including the basement. Our previous top level router supplied by our cable provider, failed to provide an adequate WIFI signal throughout the house. Finally on recommendation and researching routers, we decided to purchase the NETGEAR Nighthawk C-7000 to see if it would make a difference. We also had two WIFI boosters (plug in an outlet type), one on the main level, the other on the top floor and now with the Nighthawk C-7000, we have had excellent and continuous WIFI coverage on all three levels. We are extremely satisfied with our purchase. And, by returning our cable router, we no longer have to pay the $11 monthly rental fee.
customer_reviews.author: Optima15

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice For A MODEM/Router Combo
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched to Comcast XFINITY for Internet service and I decided to purchase a MODEM/Router combo to avoid rental fees. I checked what was available on Amazon that was XFINITY compatibile. After reading reviews I chose the NETGEAR Cable Modem WiFi Router Combo C6250 and it has turned out to be a great choice so far. Internet speeds are better than advertised and the WiFI signal is strong throughout the house. I can't comment on Tech Support because I haven't needed it. The unit is fairly new but I will update this review if there is any problem with long term reliability (which I don't expect with a Netgear product).
customer_reviews.author: William P.

customer_reviews.title: Best WiFi System
customer_reviews.text: This is the best WiFi system I'm owned. I tried everything and every brand to get a good signal throughout my 2 story townhouse. I finally folk up the money for this system. I can't be any more happier. I subscribed to Spectrum 400mbps plan and I now get consistent signal throughout my house. Highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Thai

customer_reviews.title: 5G is unusable
customer_reviews.text: I'm on Comcast. I get 200mbps but randomly router drops connections on 5G. I can't get DNS resolved and gateway is unreachable. I have disabled 5G completely because of this random drops, when it happens it is unusable. 5G speeds is great when it works, but random drops make it unusable. Netgear forums do not offer any help, all issues are marked as Solved but that looks like an automated bug closing system pointing to dead end links. Now I am purely on 2.4 now and speeds are horrendous. I am considering buying another router and I will use this purely as a modem. This has been a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Culver

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT COMPATIBLE with SPECTRUM
customer_reviews.text: Got the modem up and running, was about to activate it then Spectrum says " This is not an approved modem".Called Spectrum and verified, they said this modem is certified as one that does not have negative impact on Spectrum network, but not one that is certified to work with Spectrum and speed tested. Returning it. I know I should've done my homework but I got this on Prime day and it advertises as "Compatible with all Cable Providers", which is a lie. Do your homework before buying it.
customer_reviews.author: pinky

customer_reviews.title: Scammers
customer_reviews.text: Got hacked by someone pretending to work for their company after calling their support number. Tech claimed he worked for netgear got on our computer and asked us to open our bank account. My husband took this outside and busted it to pieces with a hammer. Scammers! Charged $399 on our charge card for bogus support...beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: TAMMY L SHELTON

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!! You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: This modem and router are EXCELLENT!!!! If you are on the fence about buying this product, go for it! I have optimum and their router and modem is NOT very good. It is very plug-n-play. Most of the work endured was with optimum to get their signal to connect the modem to their system. Once the signal was picked up, smooth sailing not to mention all the incredible control and parental support features. Highly highly recommended product!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up. Great range.
customer_reviews.text: My previous router had terrible range, only reaching about three quarters of the house. This Netgear reaches every corner of the house. Setup was straightforward and fast. Price is not the lowest, but for something that's to be used for years and being relied upon everyday, I figure it's wise to pay a little more for quality. Bonus: all its antennas are concealed. Makes for a much cleaner look, compared to those alien looking models currently on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Mugen

customer_reviews.title: I would avoid this router
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. Others may be correct when they say don't buy a router/modem combo. I bought this because my previous netgear router konked out after 4 years. As soon as I got this I noticed internet speed slowed down, Netflix buffered more often and my PC was constantly having connectivity issues. I never had these problems with the previous equipment. I'm beyond irritated.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie McClusky

customer_reviews.title: There technical  support is the worst
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to resolve issues since July 18th and I get the run around and even hung up on. Told they would call me back and never do. I was supposed to be getting 100 mbps download speed, I was getting 40%. I'm still without a modem and it's August 12th. I purchased a service contract with them which means nothing. It's supposed to get me expedited services, ha, It hasn't given me a darn thing. Take my advise folks, stay away from Netgear, there product sucks and especially their support, don't tell me I didn't warn you.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ames

customer_reviews.title: Netgear AC1600 Problems with Xfinity connection
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I ordered and it is not working properly. I blamed Xfinity for all the issues and called them repeatedly over the last 6 months. It was the Netgear router the whole time. I replaced the first one, thinking the issue was because it was used/discounted and ordered a brand new one at full price. Set up is easy and it appears to work but WiFi goes out constantly. Greatly disappointed and now it’s to late to return it. Now I have to pay $13/mo to rent a router unless I find one that will actually work. Netgear is usually good but this particular model has failed me.
customer_reviews.author: House of the Greater Danes

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and definitely worth the investment!
customer_reviews.text: Although it can be a little bit more pricey than budget router/modems, it's definitely a good investment over renting a modem. I would advise to buy this combo rather than trying to buy budget ones that are janky and don't work as well. I noticed a large difference in internet speed right after installation compared to the old combo device that I had. Would highly suggest to anyone interested in improving their internet speed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LAN Devices Isolated
customer_reviews.text: At some point shortly after I installed this, my LAN devices became isolated from one another. Couldn't see each other, couldn't RDP to each other, couldn't ping each other. Very not good. Also, this unit does not allow LAN Multicast, which is also very not good (for me, at least). Delivered 100% on the advertised speed for both modem and router (hence the 2nd star), but networking/routing seems poorly engineered. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: DJDave

customer_reviews.title: Amazing ! Set me free from horrible rental equipment
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing ! This has to be the best purchase I have made in a very long time , previously had xfinity's " top of the line" rental equipment that was costing me 20$ a month . It could barely cover my house with their xfi pods . After months of headache and lies on their end I decided to take a chance on the orbi . Thank goodness I did ! My coverage and speeds are amazing even with multiple steaming going on . I highly recommend this ! Thank you Netgear !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos b

customer_reviews.title: Reduces wifi speed degradation
customer_reviews.text: I was having issues with wifi connection speed as it would drop as more items were connected. However, once I used the Orbi's mesh coverage, wifi speed was no longer a concern. When I had a normal DSN router, as soon as I enabled my security cameras to send to the Cloud, wifi connection for any device slowed to a crawl. But, with the Orbi, I can still send security camera feed online and not see any degradation to wifi service. I have been very impressed with the Orbi that I purchased a second set.
customer_reviews.author: spbagwell

customer_reviews.title: I am now the owner and not the renter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to stop paying the cable company rental fees for the use their router. It was a little pricey compared to some others, but it has paid for itself and no more rental fees. Also, I've had less problems staying online. It was easy to setup and I have never had to call technical support. The little manual was fairly easy to follow. The signal is strong enough so that I can work online on the second floor of our home perfectly. We've had as many as 8 wifi users online at the same time without any problems. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sworking

customer_reviews.title: Instant Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: Using Spectrum 400 GBs - Once I did the basic setup and connected I pulled the network stats from my Xbox X: Download: 542.35 Upload: 18.34 Latency: 17 ms Packet Loss 0% Yeah, it works great. And that's without using all the extra features and settings this device offers.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: First one a LAN port didn't work, second one the wireless cuts out constantly
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. My first unit needed to be restarted on a daily basis because one of the LAN ports would die and never come back. My second unit's wireless goes unresponsive for a minute multiple times per hour. I've had other modem/routers hooked up to this cable connection so I know it's not that. I'll not be buying Netgear again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem/router but turned out to be refurbished/unable to activate w/Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Netgear is a snap to install and configure, but the one I received appears to have been returned to the seller. After I set up the Netgear as a replacement for my Comcast/Xfinity modem I called to activate it with Comcast. They told me their system couldn't activate it because the serial number of the unit was already registered to another Comcast account. I ordered a second Netgear C6250 but this time I called Comcast and had them check the s/n on he box before i opened it. Good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had this two years ago!
customer_reviews.text: This thing changed our WiFi life. I’m not tech savvy ay all but this was super easy to use and install. We replaced our old modem and router with this one piece of equipment. It increased the strength of our WiFi throughout our house and stopped the lag on our tv when streaming. We were going to buy a new TV when the streaming finally got so annoying we couldn’t stand it. Turns out we just needed to upgrade our internet equipment.
customer_reviews.author: cmf237

customer_reviews.title: Decent router for the price
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to install, looks good, and shipped quickly. My internet provider (Comcast/Xfinity) upgraded my internet service and then I was told that my old modem/router didn't support the new speeds. I looked at options and this one from Netgear stated it would support the new speeds. To my disappointment, I have not noticed any difference in my internet speeds and now feel like I generally wasted money and could have continued to use the old unit. Not sure if this is a Comcast issue or the NetGear modem/router.
customer_reviews.author: mmrbarto

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over the Xfinity modem/router.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the included installation instructions and setup was a breeze. After a 10 minute call with Comcast we were up and running. Much better signal everywhere in the house and the Firestick doesn’t buffer anymore! I would recommend this as an upgrade to anyone renting the cable modem/router from Xfinity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Wifi/Modem for online gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace my Norton Core that I recently purchased because it absolutely would not allow for high speed online gaming (security scan of all incoming data caused high ping!). This Netgear is working fantastically right out of the box with no configuration or messing with settings. Just called Spectrum after installing it and they sent the activation signal to it and voila, awesome modem/wifi in one neat small package. The Netgear Genie app is a great companion for monitoring the devices on my network. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Brown

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 2 days
customer_reviews.text: Literally stopped powering on after 2 days of normal use. Not sure if this was a fluke or not, but when I called the support number, the person on the other end had so much background noise I could barely hear him. He hung up when I said I was having trouble hearing through the noise. I called back again and the system dropped my call. I think I just decided I would just use Amazon return policy at that point and stopped trying. Netgear = not worth the time. I ended up going with Arris Surfboard Modem and Google Wifi combo which is still going strong after 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Nice Design
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty rad. Looks great, works exceptionally well. I love the included smaller satellite, I have it placed upstairs in a loft on my work desk and plug my surface pro directly in via Ethernet and the signal is strong. Most router/modems are big space age looking contraptions usually in the color of black. This Orbi is different, it’s a nice oval design in white and sort of disappears in a room, in that it does not intrude on the rooms overall design. Nice work on this one NETGEAR!
customer_reviews.author: Tom George

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE: Refurbished item
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this modem/router combo directly from Amazon, read and re-read the listing, and expected a new unit. Instead, they sent a refurbished item without any instructions, warranty info, or anything. Just a router in a box. Suddenlink was unable provision the unit because of security issues with it being refurbished. Will be returning. Amazon should disclose "used" or "refurbished" status in the listing!
customer_reviews.author: Amie White

customer_reviews.title: Works well on  Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace rental xfinity modem. This a combo unit modem/router. Install was easy with Netgear guides. Took about 15 minutes and didn’t have to contact cable company at all. Browser interface is easy and straightforward. Immediately saw speed increase in modem speed and Wi-Fi speed. If your changing from existing router just install and change Wi-Fi name and PW to that of the old one and all your devises won’t even know there’s a new router in town.. Nothing go set up.
customer_reviews.author: Mudflap

customer_reviews.title: Fast wifi, good range in home.
customer_reviews.text: My older modem/router combo was giving me problems, so I looked around on Amazon to replace it with any brand. I chose this NetGear 1900ac combo, and I couldn't be happier. Very easy setup and installation with Comcast Xfinity. Took about 10 minutes total for it to be recognized by Comcast. Internet speed is over 200 mbs over wifi!! I recommend that anyone consider these combo modem routers; why have separate ones that require extra wires, power plugs, etc?
customer_reviews.author: Cap'n Beefheart

customer_reviews.title: Not actually compatible with Xfinity at full speed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the orbi because it stated it was compatible with comcast/xfinity. After 3 hours on the phone with xfinity support because of slow internet speeds (we pay for 1000 mb/s speed), xfinity confirmed that the orbi modem is only a docsis 3.0 modem and therefore is only compatible with their slower internet speeds... So now that I have to replace my brand new orbi with a *better* modem, I essentially have a $300 Orbi paperweight. As a paperweight, this product works fairly well indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Netgear.
customer_reviews.text: This product only lasted 5 months and stopped connecting. I ended up renting the cable company modem/router so I could connect to the internet. And I have to purchase a service agreement before netgear will look at my issue even though there is a 1 year warranty. Ridiculous!!!! I will never buy Netgear anything. What a joke! If I could rate a 0 I would!!!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Young

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction after 3
customer_reviews.text: I purchased on Feb 19, 2020 and on May 18, 3 months later, we started experiencing issues where we didn’t have internet at all for multiple days. When we called netgear for tech support, they say that I need to purchase a 3 month plan for 49.99 in order to get their help, otherwise They’d give me the self help guide. The self help guide is fine, but it’s a LITTLE too coincidental that it started not working after almost 3 months exactly. Will never purchase netgear products again.
customer_reviews.author: bump

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: This is a strong modem WiFi router combo that provides a 5x5 signal throughout my 3-level home. Easy-to-follow setup instructions and decent quality. My only gripe is that one of the antenna attachment points wasn't tight -- only discovered *after* I tried to attach the antenna on that side. Took a bit of maneuvering to get it removed and then tighten the nut to secure the fixture. Checked the others, all OK.
customer_reviews.author: Library Champion

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Netgear support is horrible. Amazon support is awesome though glad I bought this pile from amazon so at least I can return it. Constantly reset itself and needed to set it up from scratch over and over. Then finally stopped broadcasting WiFi signal and tech support from netgear says to use reset button even after I told them that button did not work. She then tried to sell me on a technical support package so she could further assist me.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Xfinity service
customer_reviews.text: Well, not clear if this was faulty equipment or if this is on Xfinity, but this is most definitely NOT compatible with Xfinity service. After spending over an hour on the phone, had to give up and reactivate my old modem. Could never get anyone at Netgear on the phone to figure out if this was faulty equipment. My guess is that this is on Comcast/Xfinity. If I could spend $0 with them I would.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Better than paying extra to the cable company
customer_reviews.text: We bought this rather than pay Comcast/Xfinity $10 a month to “rent” their modem. (We’d had ATT and they provided us a modem as part of the package). It works well though the signal is not strong enough to reach the back porch which is 20’ away. And it seems a bit overwhelmed because we have the TV, doorbell, thermostat, alarm system, my laptop, the PC and both our cell phones hooked up to it. Not sure it’s the modem or Xfinity. The size is small and slim. We have it on a narrow table behind the couch and under the TV in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: WickedfastBMW

customer_reviews.title: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace our spectrum/charter modem and update our wifi and omgosh so glad we did no more glitches. Wish I had done this sooner. Been fighting with charter for years due to my box going out so much and since upgrading to this we have had no interruptions. All phones computers tvs run non stop on wifi while playing on the Wii xbox1 with no glitches outages freezes or having to stop lose everything to reset a modem.
customer_reviews.author: LittleTreeFrog

customer_reviews.title: Good product, terrible set up
customer_reviews.text: It's a good Cable modem router; It's basically the same as the comcast provided, without the telephone modem. The problem comes with set up; Its a pain. They dont print a QR code on the router, which is stupid, their proprietary software doesn't know how to connect to it without internet, and it couldn't even find the modem using its own mac address. I had to call Comcast and wait over 30 minutes for them to fumble around
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Junk on the modem side.
customer_reviews.text: As with my last netgear, regularly loses sync with cable signal and spends as long as 20 minutes or more before reconnecting. Total garbage. If you are looking for a modem for rectum cable internet, look elsewhere. The router/switch side is good. Netgears ui is my favorite for ease of use. But between my problems with their junk arlo system and cable modems, I just cant reccomend them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet speed is extremely slow
customer_reviews.text: I installed this to save money on my current Xfinity modem. I ran a speed test before disconnecting the Xfinity modem and was receiving the expected up/down speeds. Once I installed this gateway and did the necessary configuring, restart comptuer, etc. and ran a speed test my download speed was 50% of my original speed and my upload speed was 1/8 the original speed. This is unacceptable, and looking online for troubleshooting it seems the only resolution is "factory reset", which doesn't make much sense when this is the speed that came out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Cable Modem WiFi Router Combo C6250 - Compatible with all Cable Providers including Xfinity by Comcast, Spectrum, Cox | For Cable Plans Up to 300 Mbps | AC1600 WiFi speed | DOCSIS 3.0
product_meta.description: Style:300Mbps Max Download | WiFi AC1600| Pattern Name:SingleThe NETGEAR C6250 provides 16 times faster download speeds, up to 680 Mbps, than DOCSIS 2.0. With C6250 2-in-1 AC1600 Wi-Fi router with DOCSIS 3.0 cable modem, you can streaming HD videos, faster downloads, and high-speed online gaming without any interruption. Certified and worked with cable Internet providers like XFINITY from Comcast, Spectrum, COX, Cablevision and more. Customer-owned modems may not be compatible with certain cable networks. Please check with your cable provider to confirm this NETGEAR modem is allowed on your cable network. Check your cable Internet service provider web site for data speed tier compatibility
feature_bullets: COMPATIBLE WITH ALL MAJOR CABLE INTERNET PROVIDERS: Including certification by Xfinity by Comcast, COX, and Spectrum. NOT compatible with Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, DSL providers, DirecTV, DISH and any bundled voice service.
SAVE MONTHLY RENTAL FEES: Model C6250 replaces your cable modem and WiFi router saving you up to $168/yr in equipment rental fees.
BUILT FOR FAST SPEED: Best for cable provider plans up to 300 Mbps speed.
FAST WiFi PERFORMANCE: Get up to 1500 sq ft wireless coverage and 25 devices connected with AC1600 speed (up to 1600 Mbps).
VERSATILE CONNECTIONS: 2 Gigabit Ethernet ports and 1 USB port give you fast wired connections to your computer, printer, game box, storage drive, and other devices.
MODEM TECHNOLOGY: Engineered with 16x4 channel bonding and DOCSIS 3.0.
SAFE & SECURE: Includes parental controls, and supports WEP and WPA/WPA2 wireless security protocols.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars9,010 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
